li.title: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p: Apple is seeking a Manager International Transaction Taxes based in the Santa Clara or Austin to provided international tax law analysis for Apple’s various business offerings and initiatives. The ideal candidate will operate as a business partner and be comfortable working closely with various business teams and software engineers in order to gain a deep understanding of Apple’s various products and offerings, including hardware and media products, along with the supporting financial systems. Using this deep understanding the candidate will help develop taxability determinations, design related tax requirements that clearly articulates the taxability requirements, and drive the implementation of the tax transaction tax solution. Area of responsibility is the non-Americas regions.

ul.li: Deep knowledge (5+ years of experience) of indirect tax in at least one non-Americas jurisdiction;
Working knowledge of non-America’s indirect tax;
Knowledge of Vertex, Taxware, Thomson Reuters, etc. a plus.
Strong tax research and analytical skills;
Able to extract, analyze, and review data and make appropriate recommendations;
Ability to simplify complex modeling and tax issues into high level presentations for business partners;
Experience working in a large multinational or a professional services firm;
Exposure to or basic knowledge of transaction tax calculation and compliance software highly beneficial;
Hard working, quicker learner with a positive ''can do'' attitude and solid professionalism;
Able to work in a fast paced, informal, and often ambiguous environment;
Must be a self-starter who is able to work independently and interface with all relevant internal teams and external business partners is needed;
Strong organizational, interpersonal, communication, and project management skills;
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely with all levels of management; and

div.p: Must have BA or BS, preferably in accounting, taxation, or business; JD, CPA or graduate degree in accounting, taxation, or business is a plus.
